prompt:
Find the smallest positive real number $C$ for which
\[\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -2 \end{pmatrix} \bold{v} \right\| \le C \|\bold{v}\|\]for all two-dimensional vectors $\bold{v}.$

Note that for a two-dimensional vector $\mathbf{a},$ $\|\mathbf{a}\|$ is the magnitude of $\mathbf{a}.$Please reason step by step, and put your final answer within \boxed{}.
output:
For any two-dimensional vector $\bold{v} = \begin{pmatrix} x \\ y \end{pmatrix},$ we have

\begin{align*}
\left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 0 & -2 \end{pmatrix} \bold{v} \right\| &= \left\| \begin{pmatrix} 2x + 3y \\ -2y \end{pmatrix} \right\| \\
&= \sqrt{(2x+3y)^2 + (-2y)^2} \\
&= \sqrt{4x^2 + 12xy + 9y^2 + 4y^2} \\
&= \sqrt{4x^2 + 12xy + 13y^2} \\
&\le \sqrt{(4x^2 + 4y^2) + 12xy + 9y^2} \\
&= \sqrt{(2x + y)^2 + 9y^2} \\
&\le \sqrt{(2x + y)^2 + 9y^2 + 6xy} \\
&= \sqrt{(2x+y)^2 + 3y(2x+y)} \\
&= \sqrt{(2x+y)^2 + 3y(2x+y) + \frac{9}{4}y^2 - \frac{9
